revised_title: The Pathology of Dropsy Produced by Obstruction of the Superior and Inferior Venae Cavae and the Portal Vein
tldr: The author investigates the effects of obstructing the superior and inferior venae cavae and the portal vein on the production of dropsy and the circulation of blood in cats. The results show that obstruction of these veins leads to oedema and changes in blood pressure, challenging Starling's theory of hydrsemic plethora.
